author: parithosh
content: We'd like to announce the deprecation of the Zhejiang testnet (https://zhejiang.ethpandaops.io/). author: mariusvanderwijden
content: <@425572898787426305> I would like to drop the requirement to return executionpayloadv1 before shanghai

author: m.kalinin
content: You mean to deprecate it?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: And I would like to go to a system where versions are tied to specific hardforks

author: m.kalinin
content: so, no changes between hardforks would be allowed?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: So that it's not possible to call v3 before shanghai etc

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Well you could still backport the change to the last hardfork

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: But not this v2 can be called in merge and shanghai thing

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: The logic (at least for us) is extremely fragile and kinda hard to reason about and the place where most bugs occurred in shanghai

author: m.kalinin
content: Oh, I see. So V2 is strictly for Shanghai, V3 is strictly for Cancun, etc

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: And with get caps we have a good way to check capabilities beforehand

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes

author: m.kalinin
content: and V3 can potentially be extended to Prague if there are no changes to the Engine API?

author: m.kalinin
content: If the change is backward compatible. All backward incompatible changes can wait for the next hardfork. Would you mind to file an issue with this proposal? Btw, I am curious what if we add a new field to the payload for instance, is this a change that can be backported?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yep we can backport that

author: m.kalinin
content: Oh, actually `getPayloadV3` that still returns `ExecutionPayloadV2` but has some additional field in the response doesn't break this. You can't call this new method before Shanghai, but one will be able to call `getPayloadV2` and `getPayloadV3` before Cancun
